title: Homeopathy for coronavirus treatment: Does it work? | The Times of India
description: Ministry of AYUSH, in its latest guidelines, recommended the use of a traditional homeopathic drug as a form of preventive medicine against COVID-19.
cleaned_text: With over 5 million cases globally, the pandemic doesn't show any signs of slowing down. In India, infection cases are close to crossing the 2 lac mark, making experts worry about the peak of the infection. [readmore](javascript://) 02/9Do alternate treatments work in prevention of coronavirus? As the race for a cure or vaccine intensifies, medical researchers and doctors have been experimenting with different drugs, medicines to see if there is a possible cure for the problem. Alternative and complementary medicine forms, such as Ayurveda are also being studied extensively. One such among them is homeopathy, which is being currently studied as a treatment form. [readmore](javascript://) 03/9Homeopathy for coronavirus treatment Ministry of AYUSH, in its latest guidelines, issued an advisory to states across the country recommending the use of a traditional homeopathic drug, Arsenic album 30 as a form of preventive medicine against COVID-19. Its prophylactic use has been advised in states like Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Kerala and Maharashtra and in some places, it has been used in high-risk areas. In places like Bhopal, claims were raised when doctors said that mild COVID cases were successfully treated with homeopathy. [readmore](javascript://) 04/9WHO does not recommend homeopathy against COVID-19 In the past too, there have been questionable claims circulating on social media surrounding the use of homeopathy against COVID-19. However, since it's an alternative form of medicine, there are concerning matters of debate over the same. World Health Organisation, for one, does not suggest or recommend the usage of homeopathic forms of medicines for the treatment of coronavirus. [readmore](javascript://) 05/9Can homeopathy work in fighting COVID-19? There is no scientific claim which actually benefits the usage of homeopathy drugs, which makes people wonder if this is the safest course of treatment right now. The state of matters has also led to people flocking to shops and medicinal clinics to hoard homeopathic drugs, which are now selling at triple the cost. [readmore](javascript://) 06/9Why is Arsenic album 30 being recommended? Homeopathy has been widely hailed as a "safe" and "side-effect" free form of treatment, especially in cases persisting with trivial symptoms like that of a cold and flu. In the past, it was also seen as an effective form of medicine in fighting epidemics like malaria, cholera, ebola as well. Since homeopathy, like ayurvedic medicines, are usually natural concoctions, they are termed safe and do not carry the side-effects which often come along with allopathic medicines. [readmore](javascript://) 07/9The use of Arsenic Album 30 Arsenic Album is a common homeopathic medicine, used in the treatment of common cold, cough or the flu. It contains minute traces of arsenic, which is repeatedly heated in distilled, filtered water for a long time. A cheap cure, Arsenic album has been considered to fight off any inflammation in the body. This medicine is also effective in treating throbbing frontal headache, burning chest pain, restless, and fearful. Homeopathy has also been suggested to battle some of the other symptoms associated with a flu-like infection, which have also been observed in COVID positive patients. The use of homeopathic medicines like Eupatorium Perfoliatum Q, Belladonna 3c and others given in high frequency helps reduce the acute discomfort that patients feel, without the addition of many allopathic medicines. [readmore](javascript://) 08/9What's the debate then? There is no sure shot proof that homeopathy can emerge as the best form of defence against a pandemic of such large proportions. Studies are stil underway to see how far it works, what are the shortcomings and observe the efficacy of the same. [readmore](javascript://) 09/9Does homeopathy work for all? In some places, while traditional medicine is preferred, homeopathy is still prescribed as a form of immunity-boosting, or prophylactic medicine but is not being actively encouraged. There is also no clinical or large-scale trial till date, which again, adds to the tension. Secondly, even if homeopathy does work, there is no proof that it shows the same effects for everyone. Each individual may react differently and hence, cannot be depended on universally. DISCLAIMER: The views expressed in this article should not be considered as a substitute for a physician's advice.
